plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub with clusters of fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in warm climates, often found in Mediterranean and subtropical regions.
plants.location: Mediterranean, Southern United States, subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested, but it is widely cultivated for its beautiful, long-lasting flowers.

plants.name: Eucalyptus pauciflora
plants.description: A eucalyptus species native to the high country of southeastern Australia, known for its attractive white to cream flowers that appear in late autumn to winter.
plants.funFact: Snow Gums are adapted to cold alpine environments and their flowers provide important nectar sources in winter for native birds and insects.

plants.name: Winter Jasmine (Jasminum nudiflorum)
plants.description: A deciduous shrub prized for its bright yellow flowers which bloom on bare stems in late winter to early spring, often starting in December in milder climates.
plants.location: China (native), cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Winter Jasmine blooms vigorously even in cold weather and is often used to brighten winter gardens.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large, glossy leaves and rose-like flowers that typically bloom in late fall through early spring, celebrated for its elegant blooms in winter gardens.
plants.location: Japan, China, Korea; also widely cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers have inspired East Asian art and culture for centuries, symbolizing purity and longevity.
